unnormalised: Hey guys, Diwali's just around the corner, and guess what? The gas cylinder prices are up again! Seems like Lakshmi Mata brought a bit of inflation with her this year.
normalised: Hey guys, Diwali's just around the corner, and guess what? The gas cylinder prices are up again! Seems like Lakshmi Mata brought a bit of inflation with her this year.

unnormalised: Bharat Petroleum, HP, and Indane have all bumped up prices effective from Nov 1st. A standard 14.2 kg cylinder will now cost you approximately Rs. 1150 in Delhi, and prices vary slightly in Mumbai and Chennai.
normalised: Bharat Petroleum, H P, and Indane have all bumped up prices effective from November first. A standard fourteen point two kilogram cylinder will now cost you approximately rupee one thousand one hundred and fifty in Delhi, and prices vary slightly in Mumbai and Chennai.

unnormalised: That's going to sting a bit, especially for families preparing festive feasts like gulab jamun and chakli. Dr. Sharma from the All India Consumer Forum says this price hike is "untimely and unjustified."
normalised: That's going to sting a bit, especially for families preparing festive feasts like gulab jamun and chakli. Doctor Sharma from the All India Consumer Forum says this price hike is "untimely and unjustified."

unnormalised: Plus, subsidized cylinders for Ujjwala Yojana beneficiaries have also seen a minor increase of around Rs. 50.
normalised: Plus, subsidized cylinders for Ujjwala Yojana beneficiaries have also seen a minor increase of around rupee fifty.

unnormalised: This news is definitely going to make a dent in household budgets, especially with real estate prices in areas like Bandra already sky-high (averaging Rs. 60,000 per sq ft!). Looks like we'll all be pinching pennies a little harder this Diwali. Maybe switch to cooking on a chulha? Just kidding (mostly)!
normalised: This news is definitely going to make a dent in household budgets, especially with real estate prices in areas like Bandra already sky-high (averaging rupee sixty thousand per square foot!). Looks like we'll all be pinching pennies a little harder this Diwali. Maybe switch to cooking on a chulha? Just kidding (mostly)!
